description: Support the Diplomatic Security Services (Department of State) High Threat Protection mission by preparing and presenting daily intelligence briefs for the Regional Security Officer (RSO) and Personal Security Detail (PSD) teams, drafting the Iraq Intelligence Summary, responding to requests for information, and performing route and venue threat assessments. Complete in-depth intelligence studies of terrorist organizations and associated tactics and weapons, to include improvised explosive devices (IED). Analyze tactical intelligence in order to provide the U.S. Ambassador to Iraq with finished operational and strategic level all-source intelligence products. Coordinate with national agencies and provide liaison support to Iraqi intelligence and operations offices.

description: • Supervised team focusing on global terrorism, managing production of a multi-member section providing optimal coverage of target areas • Skilled in numerous Intelligence Community analytic tools/databases for research, analysis, and reporting • Fully qualified Target Digital Network analyst with experience • Monitored multiple targets of interest using DNI and DNR databases that led to feedback from multiple Intelligence Agencies • Perform data mining, research, analysis, technical development, and produce documentation of international communications in support of both national and field-level consumer requirements • Managed customer relationships for specific mission areas using a variety of communications means ensuring mission accomplishment • Auditor ensuring the protection of the privacy rights of the United States persons provided by the United States constitution • Trained, authorized, and experienced administrator for an account management database • Answered RFI’s from other Intelligence Community Agencies resulting in positive feedback • Branch Non-Commissioned Officer in Charge (NCOIC) managing joint service-personnel, effectively managed administrative and financial actions, maintained positive accountability, and ensured mission accomplishment • Supervised, managed, and mentored junior subordinates which cultivated a more proficient and effective work force • Served as a Branch Security Manager for joint-service and civilian personnel, ensuring accountability and security of classified information in the workspace • Provided analysis as part of a Target Development team to discover possible new leads and pass them to the Target Office of Primary Interest (TOPI) • Performed analysis, and answered RFI’s, and briefed events in response to a world event • Trained over 400 Soldiers on resiliency which led to a more productive and healthy workforce

description: • Deployed as a SIGINT Analyst for the G2 Analysis and Control Element (ACE) of the 4th Infantry Division and United States Division-North (USD-N) in support of Operation New Dawn • Filled a large number of Requests for Information (RFI), in direct support of tactical level customers, supporting multiple customers from worldwide partners • Experienced in processing, analyzing and reporting intelligence data for national and tactical level consumers. • Supported ground SIGINT collection operations, SIGINT operations coordination and synchronization, Quality Control (QC) and Quality Assurance (QA) of SIGINT reporting products • Briefed SIGINT analytic and reporting products to G2, Officer in Charge (OIC), and various analytic cells • Conducted analysis of raw data and built RFI products to be briefed to key supervisory personnel • Authored numerous SIGINT reports in support of multiple provinces Area of Responsibility to include QA, QC, and release to include numerous reports from smaller units at remote locations • Collaborated with multi-intelligence sources to coalesce complete intelligence products to further refine target development • Provided indications and warning tipping and force protection reports directly to Brigade Combat Teams (BCT’s) • Managed, mentored, and supervised junior subordinates • Developed Standard Operating Procedures for SIGINT Reporting, SIGINT Applications, and SIGINT QC process • Generated SIGINT summary (SIGSUM) and dispersed throughout United States-Iraq operating areas

description: 2011-2013 Advance Collection Team, U.S Army 7th Special Forces Group (A), EGLIN AFB, FL Served as a Senior Signals Intelligence/Electronic Warfare (SIGINT/EW) Cryptologic Linguist and collection equipment operator in the Technical Control and Analysis Element (TCAE) for the 7th Special Forces Group (Airborne) operating in the CENTCOM and SOUTHCOM Areas of Operations; Assists with technical, analytical and linguistic support for 7th Special Forces Group (Airborne) primary areas of operations. - Provided numerous training with peers to ensure they were trained proficiently in tactical ground equipment; UHF/HF/VHF/Wolfhound System/PRD-13 System/DRT1500 box. - Trained with TICOM Geometrics on GEONET software while still in its testing phase and development. - Trained and became qualified on Counter Electronic Warfare Systems during a three week Electronic Warfare Maintainer course.

description: 2009-2011 Senior Cryptologic Linguist, 75th Ranger Regiment, Ft Benning, GA Senior Cryptologic SIGINT Linguist for a globally deployable tactical Operational SIGINT Team (OST) which conducts Signals Intelligence (SIGINT) and Electronic Warfare (EW) operations in support of the 75th Ranger Regiment Special Troops Battalion and the three Ranger Line Battalions; responsible for exploitation and analysis of communication devices; which conducts SIGINT/EW and radio reconnaissance operations in denied, hostile, and politically sensitive areas; responsible for all linguistic duties for languages in Central and South America; responsible for operational training for the CENTCOM areas of Operations. - Received Army impact award for numerous Tactical combat Operation. - Produced numerous SIGINT reports in response to Request for information from Task Force personnel resulting in the detainment of numerous High Value Targets. - Led SIGINT Team in numerous tactical Objectives who... - Worked as the Geospatial SIGINT Analyst Exploitation NCOIC for a Tactical Screening Facility; CELLEX, DOCEX section. - Conducted Task Force SIGINT daily briefings, Analysis, Target Development, Tactical equipment training, and Mission Support during tactical deployment during Operation Enduring Freedom (OEF).

description: Team leader in charge of a team of 7 people conducting COMINT and Geospatial SIGINT to produce timely reports for clients. Squad leader in the Army outside of the analytical shop. 2009 senior analyst and report writer for my watch during the national crisis. SME of mission crucial database and managed a team of five for technical database oversight and management of reports for the entire 50 joint forces shop. Created a homepage and multiple working aids to instruct others to optimize work output and to perform their duties correctly. Lead a team of joint service personnel; ensured tasks were evenly delegated and that each individual knew what was expected of them and worked directly with each person to make sure they knew how they could approach the project or task to achieve the most thorough result. Conducted on the job training that enabled individuals to pass their job qualification tests. Trained my replacement team leader well in advance of my departure to make sure he had the skills and confidence to perform his duties. Attended meetings and communicated regularly with peer and senior level leadership to make sure the team was supporting the mission accurately and in a timely and relevant manner up to the General level. Subject matter expert of mission crucial database; ensuring the quality of all new posts to the database and routine queries of previously entered data that was entered incorrectly. Tertiary responsibilities included managing incoming reports for the shop along with ensuring that all new reports are properly parsed to the appropriate teams. Responsible for informing the shop of all needed database current down time and predicted up times and gathering requests from the end user, interoperating those requesting into actionable tasks for the software development team.

description: Hand-picked amongst peers to supervise and train a team of six multi-service analysts to scan known and unknown frequencies to find a new transmission method being used by a target for undetected communications. Qualified as Enlisted Information Dominance Warfare Specialist and subject matter expert, created three documents compiling specific target knowledge and signals analysis tools to reduce reporting time by 80%. Spearheaded the innovative environmental search of the high-frequency spectrum and directed search methods to locate, process, and break out signals of interest to report on valuable intelligence in support of the U.S. Pacific Command. Skillful with multiple SIGINT intelligence applications, software and analyst tools including Pidgin, NSAnet, Secret Internet Protocol Router Network (SIPRNET), and open source information discovery methods. Conducted seventeen high priority SIGINT operations briefings at NSA and Intelligence Community field sites to target customers and special unit offices to expand geographic knowledge and advanced collection methods. Led the collaboration of two intelligence operations sites for new automated collection systems resulted in gathering 20,000 signals of interest and 840 special interest reports. Collected, processed, and analyzed over 31,800 SIGINT product reports providing situational awareness for units in the Pacific Area of Responsibility which greatly resulted in nearly 500 special interest reports. Maintained five multi-million dollar remote collection systems to ensure quick validation, time-sensitive reporting, and accurate geo-location in support of the U.S. pacific fleet area of responsibility. Analyzed time-critical intelligence information and produced SIGINT Threat Warning reports in support of U.S. assets in the assigned AOR. Tools used: Gale-Lite, Google Earth, Intelink, KLs, Oilstock, Intellipedia, and USSID System.

description: responsible for managing cryptologic training standards for SIGINT and Morse courses across all services and National Security Agency/Central Security Service. Managed comprehensive training standards for four operational and technical development paths at the basic, intermediate, and advanced levels of Signals Intelligence (SIGINT) analysis and Morse curricula. Coordinated and led multiple SIGINT Cryptologic Training Advisory Groups (CTAG) composed of representative/subject matter experts (SME) from all military services and NSA/CSS, for the purpose of establishing, revising, reviewing, and validating cryptologic training conducted under the auspices of an Executive Agent (EA) or Responsible Training Authority (RTA) to ensure technical adequacy. Managed the daily execution of the Cryptologic Training System (CTS) for SIGINT and Morse programs; encompassed identifying NSA/CSS and joint training requirements, designing and implementing curricula, evaluating training, and ensuring that institutional cryptologic training is accurate, current, and responsive to mission requirements of the field and tactical customers. Databases/Systems used: NSA Net, JWICS, SIPR Net, Intelink, NMCI , AMHS, MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access)

description: Led a diverse multi-person team in the Ship’s Signals Exploitation (SSES) in support of operational, national, and Theater commander. Collected Signals intelligence (SIGINT) from various types of intelligence collection assets by utilizing state of the art collection equipment such as Digital Receiver Technology (DRT) equipment and various direction finding (DF) equipment. Analytical work focused on substantive intelligence matters involving Narco-Terrorists groups and various military targets in the Middle East, Horn of Africa, Central, and South America. Driving force behind a highly trained multi-personnel watch floor that resulted in the collection and processing of numerous signals of interest, providing 5th Fleet, Office of Naval Intelligence (ONI), and the National Security Agency/ Central Security Service (NSA/CSS) with critical information. Coordinated efforts in guiding and training personnel in Signals Intelligence collections, Combat Direction Fining (CDF) in support of National and Theater commanders. As Command Personal Qualification Standard (PQS) coordinator; assigned, monitored, and reported on the PQS completion for 240 personnel to ensure that the command maintained qualified personnel to conduct tactical operations in support of National and Theater commanders. Leading Supervisor – Joint Task Force Guantanamo (JTG-GETMO) Guantanamo Bay Cuba; As Sergeant of the Guard (SOG) supervised 89 highly trained maximum security personnel. Responsible for the day-to-day safe and humane treatment of more than 160 Global War on Terrorism detainees within the maximum confines of the maximum security facility Camp Delta. Made amazing contributions to the resounding success of opening the $37 million maximum security detention facility at camp Delta. Charged with the care of 89 highly trained detainee guards in extremely arduous conditions and effectively kept moral high. Responsible for the safe and humane detainment of over 160 enemy combatants.

description: Ship’s Signals Exploitation Space (SSES) signals analyst, intercepted numerous critical enemy signals of interest in support of National and Theater commanders during Operation Enduring Freedom. Work center supervisor for two major work centers with multiple personnel assigned. Led the completion of 300 preventive maintenance checks and ensured all cryptologic equipment systems were 100% operational. Coordinated 200 training classes that led to fully operational readiness work centers. Responsible for EKMS and CMS material and accountability for the transfer of highly classified cryptologic keys for adjacent cryptologic systems - responsible for the loading, operation, & maintenance of cryptologic keying, communications, & encryption equipment/devices such as CYZ-10, KYK-13, KY-15, KOI-18, KG-84A/C, STUIII, & KIV-7 Qualified basic CMS user and Cryptologic communications supervisor. Sat up and maintained cryptologic classified material library, space accreditation and tempest accreditation.

description: Designed collection strategies and coordinated collection efforts across the CENTCOM and SOUTHCOM areas of responsibilities (AOR). These strategies and efforts allowed collection assets (Space, Air, Surface, and subsurface) to collect information on military and counter narcotics targets which allowed policy advisors and Theater commanders to gain invaluable knowledge on high valued targets. Authored numerous products on targets collected against targets of interest, which were widely disseminated across the Intelligence Community (IC) using Content Preparation Environment (CPE). As specials Signals Operator; provided expert indications and warning reports that successfully supported mission objectives in near wartime environment during missions of extreme importance to national security.

description: Provided support for airborne and ground SIGINT collection operations, SIGINT operations coordination and synchronization, and various other SIGINT activities in support of U.S. Forces Afghanistan and the International Security Assistance Forces – Afghanistan. Utilized knowledge to efficiently analyze, evaluate, report, and disseminate Sensitive intelligence information. Supported the timely, relevant, accurate and predictive SIGINT and Electronic Warfare support to enable the commander and subordinate unit commanders the ability to understand their battlespace and enemy forces. Provided indications and warnings tipping as well as force protection reports. Authored recurring reports for executive and tactical-level decision makers which identified adversarial intent, capabilities, vulnerabilities, and potential threat courses of action. Monitored unevaluated traffic received by the AROCC ONEROOF server resident on NSANet, and manipulated to ensure proper processing. Provided direct support to sensitive operations to deny, degrade, disrupt threat communication systems, operations and decision cycles. Interfaced with linguists and identified exploitation priorities critical to mission success. Developed personal proficiency in diverse NSA tasking, collection, processing, reporting procedures, and communications architecture. Daily employed working knowledge of military ground operations, target-area geography, place names, personal names, titles, and cultural norms as well as relevant enemy objectives, tactics, techniques and procedures.

description: Instructed and counseled Multi-service trainees progress; recommended remedial training as necessary. Lead soldiers in their day to day activities, training requirements, and safety concerns Coordinated with Navy Munitions Command NAS Pensacola and Fort Rucker Munitions Command for pick up and transport of ammunition and pyrotechnics. Filed. TechSIGINT Information Needs Manager/ COMINT Collector/Analyst Subject Matter Expert that managed over 700 national requirements, was the branch focal point for all Technical Signals Intelligence issues ensuring that the NSRP was satisfied. Pacific Threat Warning Coordinator for the National Security Agency/ Central Security Service (NSA/CSS) Washington, reviewed reports and developed alerts for Blue forces in Pacific AOR. Provided real time Threat warning to U.S. forces in the Pacific Area of Interest. Operated and maintained several antennas, and satellite dish’s. Lead manager for Technical Signals intelligence information exchange between NSA Washington and NSA Colorado. Utilized computer and communication systems. to detect, demodulate, capture, and analyze communication signals in digital and analog format. Provided operational testing and evaluation support to Quick Reaction Teams using modern and under development software to stream line the analysis for unknown signals Technical/ Operational Electronic Intelligence Collector/Analyst Operated computer and electronic equipment, including MARTES, GALE LITE, Digital ELINT Lab, EAGLE Recorders, ETC… for the purpose of identifying and processing high value targets. Performed in depth signals analysis on new and emerging analog and digital technologies using the latest hardware and software programs Filling NSRP requirements. Provided in-depth signals analysis training to junior enlisted personnel assigned to the shift, updating current JQR. Responsible for documenting and reporting findings to Theater and National Level Command Authorities.

description: -NSA Menwith Hill, Harrogate, England. Sept, 07 – Nov, 09 Expert on 3 separate NSA operation’s floor systems. Supervised and evaluated up to 20 employees. Successfully completed courses in analysis, DEPL and NETA. -Analyst for Signals Support Team, Iraq. Jan, 09 – Jul, 09 Lead a team of analysts responsible for 2nd Brigade’s, a hostile and target dense area of responsibility. Constructed 52 Microsoft Power Point presentations consisting of the analysis on high value targets. Disseminated 10 tactical reports and answered over 50 time-sensitive Requests for Information to tactical and strategic level planners, directly impacting combat actions against foreign insurgents. Platoon Sergeant, Intelligence Course Instructor, and Evaluator. November, 09 – February, 2012 Instructed over 31 tactical SIGINT training courses while simultaneously coordinating with NSA appointed instructor; meanwhile, maintaining responsibility for evaluating their performance, effort, and SIGINT Tactical knowledge. Instructed over 22 analysis of SIGINT training courses while simultaneously coordinating with NSA appointed instructors; meanwhile, evaluating performance, effort, and SIGINT Analysis knowledge. Performed under pressure for 13 field training exercises in Team Leader position for both tactical and analytical SIGINT operations. -Team Leader for Tactical SIGINT Operations, Afghanistan. Aug, 2010 – Feb, 2011 Lead a team of 5 Marines for Tactical SIGINT operations in aid of Marine Corps Infantry. Allocated, accountable for, and used $2.5M in tactical signals collection equipment. Created a tracking spreadsheet of over 300 targets in Microsoft Excel in a period of six months. Reduced casualty rates by 90% with over 2,000 time sensitive of indication and warning intelligence reports. Aided supported unit with tight SIGINT deadlines, intelligence interrogations, SIGINT tactical jamming, direction finding, tactical atmospheric reporting, and over 50 SIGINT aided combat patrols.

description: - Lead Electronic Intelligence (ELINT) analyst in the stand up of the Joint Exploitation & Fusion Cell at the National Security Agency/Central Security Service-Colorado (NSA/CSS-Colorado) -- Established partnerships between intelligence teams within the NSA/CSS-Colorado, United States Pacific Command (USPACOM), the Navy's Pacific Fleet (PACFLT), and NSA/CSS-Hawaii -- Advised on software development for advanced intelligence fusion & visualization tools -- Contributed expertise to establish NSA/CSS-Colorado's initial concept of operations -- Successes recognized in a Letter of Appreciation from the Deputy Director of the Department of National Intelligence (DNI) - Forged a partnership between elements of the NSA/CSS-Colorado, the United States Strategic Command (USSTRATCOM), and the DNI to collaborate on advanced intelligence fusion initiatives -- Concepts & initial progress were presented to the Vice Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff (JCS), and resulted in an additional $10,000,000 injection to expedite a solution to warfighters.

description: - Provided Electronic Intelligence (ELINT) support to F-16CJ units and Wing command staff - Operated the Tactical Data Processing System (TDPS), renamed to the Tactical Processing System (TPS) - Deployed during Operation IRAQI FREEDOM as the Expeditionary Wing's Lead Electronic Intelligence Analyst -- Coordinated & configured installation of the Tactical Receive System (TRS), enabling reliable 24x7 intelligence broadcast receive capabilities -- Devised process & procedures to overlay & assess fighter jet data with traditional intelligence data; first-of-kind non-traditional intelligence, surveillance, & reconnaissance (NTISR) capability; yielded unprecedented feedback for F-16 systems engineers to improve combat systems, and provided critical information to pilots flying real-world combat sorties.

description: Directs the training and execution of Signals Intelligence (SIGINT) collection, processing and dissemination efforts in support of force protection and counter-terrorism operations conducted throughout the United States Army-Pacific (USARPAC) area of responsibility (AOR); prepares and integrates P2/P3 supporting National Security Agency/Central Security Service-Hawaii (NSA/CSS-H) and Special Operations Command-Pacific (SOCPAC) priority intelligence requirements; responsible for the deployment readiness, morale, health, welfare and development of 35 Soldiers; accounts for $414 thousands dollars on sensitive SIGINT equipment. Additional Duties: Range Safety Officer (RSO); Casualty Assistant Officer (CAO); Casualty Notification Officer (CNO); Prisoner Escort; Unit Project Officer; Unit Key Custodian; Arms Room Key Custodian.

description: Serves as the Senior Instructor for multi-service instructors assigned to the 920-SQIA Manual Morse Course; supervises all aspects of instruction for 100 multi-service students; evaluates student performance and diagnoses learning deficiencies; trains, certifies, and evaluates instructor performance in accordance with Brigade, Battalion, and Quality Assurance Office policies and procedures; writes Programs of Instruction(POI) and Lesson Plans; creates and monitors all TS/SCI documentation associated with student and instructor performance and progress; Graduated from the Army Basic Instructor Course and earned the Basic Instructor Badge and conducted over 500 hours of POI to all students attending the course; Battalion Instructor of the Month for May 2011; Battalion NCO of the Quarter for 2nd Quarter Fiscal Year 2011; Inducted as a member into the prestigious Sergeant Audie Murphy Club for demonstrated leadership attributes and exemplary noncomissioned officer professionalism During tour was awarded MOVSM (2nd award), AAM, and ARCOM for Impact Awards.

description: NCOIC for seven Soldier operational section within the Army Europe Technical Control and Analysis Element (AETCAE); leads the signals intelligence (SIGINT) development and exploitation effort for the AETCAE; advises the AETCAE OIC and 7th Army THOC Chief on deployment of SIGINT personnel and equipment; supervises collection, analysis and dissemination of SIGINT data within the AETCAE; coordinates closely with United States Army Europe (USAREUR) G2 and United States European Command (USEUCOM) G2 pertaining to deployable platforms and specific analysis efforts of deployed platforms and ongoing intelligence operations.

description: NCOIC of the Army Europe Technical Control and Analysis Element (AETCAE) the supports an 1100 Soldier and Civilian forward-based Theater Military Intelligence Group consisting of five subordinate Military Intelligence Battalions; provides intelligence support to Army and Joint Forces in European Command AOR; serves as Platoon Sergeant for a section consisting of 74 Soldiers conducting tactical, operational and strategic Signals Intelligence/Electronic Warfare to satisfy PIRs within United States Army Europe (USAREUR) and European Command (EUCOM) Area of Operations; received MOVSM for volunteering efforts while assigned with 7th Special Forces Group (Airborne), Ft Bragg, NC. Certified on GISA and DEPL2000 Geospatial Metadata Analysis Course; Unit Victim Advocate Course

description: Served as a Voice Interceptor on a four man Special Operations Team-Alpha (SOT-A) team in support of 7th Special Forces Group which is oriented toward Central and South America with missions in Operation Enduring Freedom; executed counter-narcotics and counter-terrorist SIGINT missions in support of real-world operations in hostile and denied environments; employed portable collection equipment in overt, covert, urban, and tactical environments; performed initial processing of time-sensitive reports of actionable intelligence; provided individual and team training. Trained on Digital Receiver Technology (DRT) Systems, AN/PSC-5C Shadowfire, and various SIGINT collection systems; Completed three months of structured Spanish Language training to better augment his team's necessary skill set; completed 20K ruck march with 55lbs in three hours and 25 minutes During entire tour recieved an AAM Impact award and an AAM for PCS Award. Also, earned the Irish Parachutist Wings Foriegn Badge.

description: Human Resource Sergeant for 540 military and civilian personnel in a Military Intelligence Battalion; advises Senior Human Resource Sergeant and Adjutant on Soldier readiness and strength levels of supported units; responsible for the Electronic Military Personnel Office (E-MILPO); provides reports to companies on awards, promotions, weight control, reassignments and unit strength; prepares Daily Status Report (DSR) and Unit Strength Report (USR). received excellent ratings in 28 out of 28 areas inspected during the INSCOM IG and G1 Inspections; commended by INSCOM G1 and IG SGM for having the best S1 in INSCOM; three programs from this S1 was implemented throughout INSCOM; planned and exectued the Battalion's first S1 conference which trained Commanders, 1SGs, Platoon Sergeants and clerks on S1 procedures. During entire tour recieved a JSAM, two AAMs for Impact awards and an ARCOM for PCS Award.

description: Operated SIGINT/EW equipment to detect, acquire, identify, locate, and exploit foreign communications devices transmitting Morse and non-Morse signals. Provided processing and reporting of intercepted communications. Operated and performed operator maintenance on ground surveillance systems, organic communications equipment, light wheeled vehicles, and power sources. Assisted in emplacement, camouflage, and recovery of ground surveillance systems and associated equipment. Detected, located, and reported target data by interpreting ground surveillance system information. Served as the Senior Morse Code Opertator; Served in the Battalion Defense Force for several exercises; completed NBC School; served on the NBC Defense Team; during off time supported the Orphanage Visitation program with the children; Received an AAM for PCS Award upon completion of tour at Field Station Korea.

description: Analysis, and training as a Signals Intelligence (SIGINT) specialist. Mission System Technician & Signals & targeting analysis; Operated and maintained vital processing equipment valued in excess of $125 million at a multiservice Security Operation Center; Advised senior supervisors on equipment status, manpower, and mission efficiency Monitored, properly formatted data files, and created reports on highly diverse and complex informational systems; executed highpriority national taskings, mission notes, and integrated taskings into mission existing configuration; conducted search and survey operations which detected high-priority activities resulting in time-sensitive reports that provided sole-source intelligence to be forwarded to customer With an in depth understanding of SIGINT collection and SIGINT reporting with SIGINT end-product reports. description: • United States Army (USA) National Security Agency/Central Security Service (NSA/CSS) Counterterrorism (CT) Division, Global Network Analyst (GNA), Digital Network Intelligence Analyst (DNI), Dial Number Recognition (DNR), Voice and Graphic Analyst • Traffic Analysis and Exploitation of CT targets • Communication and coordination of Signals Intelligence (SIGINT) with various NSA shops around the globe • Translation of Persian Farsi and Dari traffic • Training junior Analysts • Utilization of analytic tools and techniques to pursue numerous high value targets across multiple geographic areas • Extensive experience and understanding of Persian Farsi and Armenian languages, literatures, cultures, and religions • Excellent command of Persian Farsi, Persian Dari, and Western Armenian • Extensive experience and skills in research, telecommunication, and computer network communication • Provide assistance to other linguists and SIGINT community on Voice and Graphic tasks • Draft and edit summaries based on various written communications • Associate Directorate for Education and Training (ADET) Certified Instructor

description: SIGINT analyst in support of US Army South (ARSOUTH). Conduct extensive technical research and long term analysis on targets and areas of interest in the South and Central America AOR. Provide weekly products on key areas of interest to the ARSOUTH planners and senior leaders with enhanced situational awareness of transnational criminal organization activities. Complete requests for information (RFIs) submitted by other intelligence shops seeking additional information to clarify, verify or disprove reported information resulting in a more complete and accurate picture. All-source intelligence analyst in support of US Army North G2 Threat Fusion Center, responsible for providing accurate and comprehensive classified and open source analytical support. Receive and process numerous intelligence reports and messages to determine the significance and reliability of incoming information. Review intelligence information reports prior to their final review and release. Provide predictive, actionable foreign intelligence and counterintelligence, situational awareness, and early warning against all threats to USARNORTH's Area of Responsibility (AOR). Provide critical and timely intelligence analysis and evaluation for short and long-term deliverables focused on an array of issues, to include target capabilities and engagements. Provide deliverables on a deadline, to ensure that time critical intelligence information was distributed through the proper channels.

description: Serve as a Counter Improvised Explosive Device (IED) and SIGINT analyst in support of Regional Command-East (RC-E), Afghanistan. Conduct extensive research for possible remote controlled IEDs and Remote FOB Trigger Type Devices identifying cells which pose a threat to Coalition Forces. Prepare, quality control, release and sanitize hundreds of tactical SIGINT reports daily that provide insight as well as key intelligence information to tactical commanders and coalition partners in the Afghanistan theater. Track division level targets of interest and summarize reporting for the different provinces within the RC-E AO for the daily reporting product.

description: Served as a Senior Training Specialist in the Training and Education Department at the National Security Agency/Central Security Service-Colorado (NSA-Colorado). Authored and provided input for multiple Job Qualification Standards (JQS), training and knowledge test for various sections within NSA-Colorado, to include a new Digital Network Intelligence (DNI) cell in order to establish lines of responsibilities, promote effective practices, and enhance required analytical skills. Continually maintained an overall awareness of new and upcoming technologies and databases to ensure a continuously up-to-date JQS.

description: -Responsible for 6 member, multi-service, 24 hour, operational Cryptologic Support Team (CST) deployed in support of 4/10 Mountain Brigade Combat Team’s (4/10 BCT) tactical and strategic operational cycle. -Represented the National Security Agency/ Central Security Service (NSA/CSS) as the on ground authority for all disseminated Signals Intelligence (SIGINT) analysis and development for the 4/10 BCT in three provinces of Afghanistan. -Provided tailored, real-time threat warning support directly to tactical commanders and decision makers in order to enable time sensitive decision making as well as provided in-depth analysis and development driving both kinetic operations and developmental operational cycles.

description: -Responsible for the daily administration and maintenance of both Security policies/procedures and execution of Soldier Security issues for a Theater Support Battalion consisting of over 400 Soldiers—stationed in both Phoenix, AZ and Honolulu, HI. -Created and implemented Battalion level Intelligence Standard Operating Procedure nested with higher requirements that provided guidance and regulation on Security policies/procedures, management of Soldier information and training, and structured security and Intelligence Oversight administrative and operational actions. -Routinely performed simultaneously as the Battalion Assistant Operations Officer responsible for daily operational and training readiness as well as responding to guidance from Battalion Operations Officer, Executive Officer, and Battalion Commander.

description: -Selected above peers to establish, facilitate, and manage a 10 member, multi-disciplined, Intelligence Readiness Operational Capability (IROC) support cell directly answering operational and strategic requirements for forward deployed senior decision makers and their subordinate ground commanders. -Reinvigorated and redefined reach relationship between CONUS support cell and down range supported unit through the creation of sustainable processes which was recognized at Division and FORSCOM levels as the standard for future IROC iterations -Developed and refined enduring relationships with supported elements while seizing opportunities to expand network of military and civilian entities, creating a high demand for IROC analytical products.

description: -Coordinated and managed the allocation of personnel, training, and other critical resources in order to facilitate six separate mobilizations tasked to the Battalion during the organization’s available year. This resulted in the successful mobilization of over 250 Soldiers, filling four unique requirements throughout Afghanistan. -Responsible for a mobilization budget of $1.2 million ensuring that pre-mobilization training was identified, coordinated, and facilitated in conjunction with higher echelon and down range requirements. -Simultaneously served as the Battalion Plans Officer, advising the Battalion Operations Officer in the establishment of training goals, objectives, and plans as well as developing and managing the planning, training, control, and supervision of battalion wide operations.

description: • Collected Signals intelligence (SIGINT) from various types of intelligence collection assets by utilizing state of the art collection equipment such as Digital Receiver Technology (DRT) equipment and various direction finding (DF) equipment in support of Operation Enduring Freedom (OEF). • Analytical work focused on substantive intelligence matters involving Narco-Terrorists groups and various military targets in the Middle East, Horn of Africa, Central, and South America. • Driving force behind a highly trained multi-personnel watch floor that resulted in the collection and processing of numerous signals of interest, providing 5th Fleet, Office of Naval Intelligence (ONI), and the National Security Agency/ Central Security Service (NSA/CSS) with critical information. • Coordinated efforts in guiding and training personnel in Signals Intelligence collections, Combat Direction Fining (CDF) in support of National and Theater commanders.

description: • Proficiency in the operation, maintenance, and repair (organizational and intermediate level) internal-combustion engines, main propulsion machinery, refrigeration, air conditioning, gas turbine engines, and assigned auxiliary equipment. • Stood watch on auxiliary boilers. Aligning and operating drain systems, stripping systems, machinery cooling water systems, oil systems, and purifier systems; aligns steam systems; operates pumps; aligns, operates, and secures internal combustion engines, steam distilling plants, compressed air systems, and refrigeration and air conditioning systems. • Records pressure and temperature readings on operating equipment; conducted tests on lubricating oil and distillate fuels; operates and maintains auxiliary boilers; maintains tools; overhauls valves; performs preventive maintenance on auxiliary equipment, main propulsion equipment, and on small craft clutches, transmissions, drive shafts, and packing glands; tests electrodynamic steering systems; inspects for leaks in reduction gears and thrust bearings. • Install, remove and replace flange shields on piping systems; fabricates and fits tubing and flexible hose assemblies; monitors electrical charging and regulating systems; operates and maintains hydraulic equipment; controls or minimizes the effects of oil and fuel spills; completes maintenance data system forms; uses blueprints, drawings, and manuals; tests boiler water and feed water.

description: - Provides support in processing and exploitation of digital intelligence information of semi-complex to complex in nature not susceptible to generally accepted methods. Provide analysis on all-source data to derive facts, inferences, and projections concerning capabilities, intention, attack approaches, and likelihood of various adversarial threat activities. - Provides support in the discovery and exploitation of target technology analysis of digital network communications in relation to Cyber. Analysis shall be conducted with consideration for applicability across various systems, technologies, operations, or adversarial objectives, each with varying level of impact. - Exercises independent judgment and expertise in selecting and developing new methods, approaches, and procedures to process or exploit intelligence data using primarily, but not solely signals intelligence information. - Assembles all raw intelligence data and information which has significant gaps and is difficult to validate. - Provides digital network intelligence to service, national, and coalition customers within defined areas of responsibility. - Maintains the integrity and standardization of Intelligence Community (IC) methodologies by closely coordinating with other specialists to ensure the use of recommended processing and exploitation analytical standards and approaches.

description: Noncommissioned Officer in Charge of NSAG Current Operations; responsible for leading an office of dozens of joint-service members, military, NSA civilian, and contractor employees conducting sensitive signals intelligence operations in support of the Global War on Terrorism. - Operated the division webpage by uploading monthly collection statistics, quality checking links, and ensuring information was accessible. - Authored more than 30 Weekly Activity Reports to inform senior leadership of the developments and accomplishments of division personnel. - Identified training deficiencies and oversaw the creation of Job qualification Standards (JQS) and Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) for Mission Thread Managers. - Recognized expert, spanning both the breadth and depth of expertise in the skills required to render technical direction as a Classification Advisory Officer (CAO). Ensured classified and sensitive information was properly labeled and protected and employees assigned to the National Security Agency/Central Security Service Georgia understood and properly applied classification rules and guidance. - Provided situational awareness on the status, health, and welfare of the targeting databases and uses and devises reports which aid in providing feedback to analysts regarding the productivity of their selector target. - Alternate targeting and compliance manager for the database targeting tools used to ensure proper account usage, data integrity and legal compliancy of all selector entries; establishes targeting guidelines to assist analysts entering selectors which ensures initial compliancy check and prospective site selection.

description: - Provides in-depth impact analysis regarding maintenance impacts resulting in lessened work burden and increased situational awareness for customers. - Briefed the NSA Georgia Commander and Watch, daily on significant system events and ongoing event coordination as well as daily dataflow issues. - Collaborates with collection managers, Mission Managers, Technicians, and Troops downrange regularly when coordinating planned system and database maintenance of upgrades for optimal scheduling while minimizing impact to mission requirements. .- Resolved customer requests for information (RFI’s) inquiring about collection and or dataflow disruptions by proficient use of multiple applications, databases, and/or tools used to troubleshoot, track, and expedite timely solutions on data flow issues. - Routinely responded to NSA-G retrieval requests. Queried, viewed and forwarded many specified files from database to the appropriate system. - Responded to requests for data over an extended period of time for a particular selector(s). - Assisted the Technology Directorate/Technical Watch Officer (TWO) by ensuring their briefing template accurately reflected background and current status of various SIGINT mission flows prior to publication and the morning stand-up brief to the Commander of NSAG. The information from that brief is also included in the Global Enterprise Command Centers Executive Summary. - Provided procedural guidance to NSAG Collection Managers (CM) for running queries on the data flow tracking and metrics reporting system. Preformed system health checks and notified CM’s when the system was degraded due to poorly constructed queries running an extended period of time. Prompt action to end a query allowed users to have access to the most recent disposition data associated with audio file information to make informed decisions regarding voice collection and analysis.

description: Deployed to hostile territory for collection and analysis resulting in production of valuable information for Global War on Terrorism. Provide expert knowledge related to accomplishing SIGINT processing, exploitations, and dissemination (PED) and intelligence fusion functions, and associated tactics, Techniques and procedures (TTPs) supporting a customer at a deployed location.- Provide real-time tactical exploitation of SIGINT data fused wide-area motion imagery and high definition motion imagery in varying modes. Created tailored intelligence products to support the operational customer from multiple SIGINT and geo-spatial information sources. Work as an integral member of cross-disciplinary intelligence exploitation cell at a deployed location. Working knowledge and recent demonstrated experience preforming SIGINT analysis and cross-cueing activities to provide actionable intelligence to the warfighter. Prepped pre-mission sorties; liaison with special units to prioritize targets & established orbit points; optimized collection tasking. Supplied real-time imagery reporting; deconflicted analysis of multi-man team; maxed target coverage for numerous missions. Created several mission area imagery templates; improved battle space situational awareness; raised reporting accuracy of numerous sorties. Trained as Sensor Ball Operator; 1 of 5 at site, only military operator; guaranteed uninterrupted imagery support on multiple targets. Standardized program’s SIGINT reporting by developing the standard operating procedures (SOP) which helped ensure the analytic quality and timeliness of several events that took place weekly. Rewrote the standard operating procedures and job qualifications standards. Produced near real time actionable intelligence during several active enemy engagements, to include passive Geo-location missions. description: Brigade S2 of an Engineer Brigade with worldwide deployment responsibilities in support of Corps, Division, and Joint operations. Responsible for providing and synchronizing all intelligence requirements providing support to over 1900 Soldiers in one engineer battalion, one chemical battalion and an EOD battalion. Leads a section of 3 Officers, 1 WO, 2 SNCOs; 4 NCOs, and 4 Soldiers in intelligence operations, Geospatial Terrain Analysis, fusion, Open Source Intelligence, and Security Operations. Determines intelligence requirements, plans intelligence collection, analyzes information, synthesizes multi-disciplinary intelligence, creates Geospatial Terrain products and disseminates intelligence to commanders in support of Brigade and Battalion operations in support of CONUS and OCONUS missions and exercises. Primary advisor to the BDE Commander and Staff on Intelligence. Advises Brigade Commander on the enemy and civilian situation and security issues. Serves as the Brigade Personnel/Information/Physical Security Manager, Brigade Provost Marshal Officer, Brigade Anti-Terrorism Officer and oversees the Intelligence Oversight Program.

description: The Army's Military Intelligence (MI) is responsible for all intelligence gathered or learned during Army missions. MI Officers are always out front, providing essential intelligence and in many cases saving Soldiers who are fighting on the front lines. Military Intelligence Officers also assess risks associated with friendly and enemy courses of action and act to counter or neutralize identified intelligence threats. The MI Officer also uses intelligence systems and data to reduce uncertainty of enemy, terrain and weather conditions for a commander. Military Intelligence Officer provides the commander with all-source intelligence assessments and estimates at the tactical, operational, and strategic levels dealing with enemy capabilities, intentions, vulnerabilities, effects of terrain and weather on operations, and predicts enemy courses of action. Directs tasking of intelligence collection assets; produces threat estimates to support doctrine, training; and combat developments; ensures proper dissemination of intelligence information and products; manages interrogation operations of enemy prisoners of war and line crossers; interprets imagery from overhead and other systems; directs counterintelligence and operational security operations; performs clandestine human intelligence operations and manages signals intelligence operations including jamming and participating in performing deception operations. Manages these tasks at all echelons.

description: Served as the Intelligence Planner within G5 Plans Section for the 7th Infantry Division. Responsible for developing, coordinating, synchronizing, and publishing operational orders and plans for the Division. Develop, execute, and monitor operational and joint planning groups ensuring all plans integrate and synchronize lethal and non-lethal effects at the operational and tactical level. Leverage and incorporate warfighting functional planners and components into the planning process. Coordinate plans with higher, adjacent and subordinate commands, staff sections and operations centers to facilitate concurrent and parallel planning and smooth transition to current operations. Coordinate daily planning actions and requirements as directed by the Division leaders to ensure all Division mission requirements are met according to planning standards and timelines.

description: Served as the Deputy Brigade S3 for Training for a 1,500 Soldier and civilian forward based theater Military Intelligence Brigade consisting of four subordinate MI battalions, which provide intelligence support to Army and Joint Forces in the European and African Command areas of responsibility; responsible for organizing, maintaining and preparing Training Guidance, as well as various Training and Readiness Briefings, including the Training Management Review to US Army Europe; provides oversight to individual and leader training, including the Noncommissioned Officer Education System and Foundry programs; responsible for advising, planning, coordinating and supervising operations and training events in support of Theater Security and International Security Cooperation efforts; provides oversight to the Brigade’s Ammunition Management program; synchronizes the efforts of 66th Military Intelligence Brigade's resources through USAREUR to INSCOM; provides oversight for the Brigade's Language Learning Center operations; assists in oversight of the training, morale, and welfare of 29 Soldiers and 8 Civilians within the Brigade S3 section.

description: Directed Signals Intelligence (SIGINT) operations conducted at the European Cryptologic Center (ECC) - a joint cryptologic organization comprised of 270 military and civilian personnel. Conducts planning, implements guidance, and prioritizes internal resources. Answers intelligence requirements from the U.S. European Command (EUCOM), U.S. Africa Command (AFRICOM) and from other customers throughout the U.S. Government, its allies and foreign partners. Ensures collaboration between national and tactical analysts for signals intelligence mission coverage. Implements short and long term objectives that improve ECC's support to AFRICOM, EUCOM, NSA, National Security Agency / Central Security Service Europe / Africa (NCEUR/AF) and other theater and national elements as required. Duty performed as joint assignment within the Analysis and Production (S2) Directorate of NCEUR.

description: Senior Intelligence Advisor for the J2, a Staff Brigadier General and the J2 Staff, at the Basra Operations Command, Basra, Iraq. Supervises, trains, and mentors the Basra Operations Command MiTT intelligence section consisting of one officer, one non-commissioned officer, and one category II interpreter. Manages and coordinates the advisory effort among the J2 intelligence section and all source cell. Advises the J2 on intelligence driven operations within United States Division - South area of operations. Provides oversight of J2 personnel issues, training, intelligence, legal system, and detainee operations, to include detainee facilities. Reports intelligence information to provide the BaOC Military Transition Team, USF, and ISF intelligence situational awareness and atmospherics improving awareness of the operational environment to enhance operations of the BaOC and USD - South.

description: Division Military Transition Team (MiTT) G2 Intelligence advisor for the 2nd Iraqi Army Division of the Iraqi Ground Forces Command in Mosul, Iraq. Manages, trains, and mentors intelligence section consisting of one officer, one non-commissioned officer, and one category II interpreter. Manages and coordinates the advisory effort among the 2 IA G2 section, ISR Company, and subordinate Brigade S2s. Advises the 2 IA G2 on intelligence driven operations within Multi-National Division - North are of operations. Provides oversight on G2 personnel issues, training, legal system, and detainee operations, to include detainee facilities. Reports intelligence information to Coalition Force intelligence organizations and enhances cooperation between CF and IA intelligence organizations. Conducts threat assessments for force protection for base operations. Conducts combat patrols vehicle CDR and convoy CDR.

description: Commanded a 60 Soldier military intelligence company which provides around the clock, real world, timely and relevant signals intelligence (SIGINT) in support of USPACOM, USFK, USSOCOM and national and tactical decisions makers; served as Deputy Chief for a joint National Security Agency/Central Security Service - Hawaii (NSA/CSS-H) department, providing command and control of 142 Soldiers, Sailors, Airman, Marines, and NSA Civilians, who produce intelligence on one of USPACOM's highest priority target nations; responsible for safety, training, discipline, morale, readiness, health and welfare for all assigned Soldiers, ensures Soldiers are trained and ready to deploy world wide at all times; responsible for the maintenance and accountability of all assigned property.

description: -Selected above peers to establish, facilitate, and manage a 10 member, multi-disciplined, Intelligence Readiness Operational Capability (IROC) support cell directly answering operational and strategic requirements for forward deployed senior decision makers and their subordinate ground commanders. -Reinvigorated and redefined reach relationship between CONUS support cell and down range supported unit through the creation of sustainable processes which was recognized at Division and FORSCOM levels as the standard for future IROC iterations -Developed and refined enduring relationships with supported elements while seizing opportunities to expand network of military and civilian entities, creating a high demand for IROC analytical products.

description: -Coordinated and managed the allocation of personnel, training, and other critical resources in order to facilitate six separate mobilizations tasked to the Battalion during the organization’s available year. This resulted in the successful mobilization of over 250 Soldiers, filling four unique requirements throughout Afghanistan. -Responsible for a mobilization budget of $1.2 million ensuring that pre-mobilization training was identified, coordinated, and facilitated in conjunction with higher echelon and down range requirements. -Simultaneously served as the Battalion Plans Officer, advising the Battalion Operations Officer in the establishment of training goals, objectives, and plans as well as developing and managing the planning, training, control, and supervision of battalion wide operations.

description: -Responsible for 6 member, multi-service, 24 hour, operational Cryptologic Support Team (CST) deployed in support of 4/10 Mountain Brigade Combat Team’s (4/10 BCT) tactical and strategic operational cycle. -Represented the National Security Agency/ Central Security Service (NSA/CSS) as the on ground authority for all disseminated Signals Intelligence (SIGINT) analysis and development for the 4/10 BCT in three provinces of Afghanistan. -Provided tailored, real-time threat warning support directly to tactical commanders and decision makers in order to enable time sensitive decision making as well as provided in-depth analysis and development driving both kinetic operations and developmental operational cycles.

description: -Authored and facilitated Signals Intelligence Needs through National SIGINT Requirements Process Standardized Intelligence Need tracking and collaboration with analysts to meet Intelligence Directorate's Priority Intelligence Requirements -Utilized intelligence requirement tools such as COLISEUM and NCI Client to interface with collection managers throughout the intelligence community and Offices of Primary Interest -Collaborated with intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance platforms to author collection plans for operational missions -Selected to position to stand up section in new format. Taught myself the Collection Management Process and took SOUTHCOM from example of what not to do to being selected to build ELINT IN that rest of community would use -Used research tools such as INTELINK, SOUTHCOM country pages and e-mail alerts to become aware of the SOUTHCOM Area of Responsibility so I could better with country analysts to write best possible information needs •Used Microsoft tools to create reports, spreadsheets and presentations for leadership to brief SIGINT activities •Liaised with key members of intelligence community to organize /task SIGINT initiatives •Wrote Collection Emphasis Messages detailing required tasks for intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance platforms to collect when flying in SOUTHCOM Area of Responsibility. •Developed and maintained automated database and operational logs. Recorded equipment status, signal characteristics and analytical findings.

description: RAND Corporation is a nonprofit global policy think tank originally formed by Douglas Aircraft Company to offer research and analysis to the United States Armed Forces. It is financed by the U.S. government and private endowment,[4] corporations[7] including the health care industry, universities[7] and private individuals.[7] The organization has expanded to work with other governments, private foundations, international organizations, and commercial organizations on a host of non-defense issues. RAND aims for interdisciplinary and quantitative problem solving via translating theoretical concepts from formal economics and the physical sciences into novel applications in other areas, that is, via applied science and operations research. Michael D. Rich is president and chief executive officer of the RAND Corporation.[8] RAND has approximately 1,700 employees. Its American locations include: Santa Monica, California (headquarters); Arlington, Virginia; Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania; and Boston, Massachusetts.[9] The RAND Gulf States Policy Institute has offices in New Orleans, Louisiana, and Jackson, Mississippi. RAND Europe is located in Cambridge, United Kingdom, and Brussels, Belgium.[10] RAND Australia is located in Canberra, Australia.[11]

description: • Successfully planned and coordinated the deployment of 268 Marines for 15 separate events across 5 continents. • Established procedures to simplify deployment process for the battalion; including establishment of an initial planning conference 6 months prior to any deployment, creating a pre-deployment checklist, and generating a turn-over procedures handbook for follow-on Future Operations Officers. • Created a doctrinal Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) for the battalion’s conduct of tactical Signals Intelligence (SIGINT) which was adopted as the battalion standard.

description: • Advised the Company Commander on all training and readiness matters for a company of 203 Marines. • Effectively trained and mentored the Platoon Commanders on day-to-day responsibilities. • Oversaw the training and evaluation component for the company's deployment preparations. • Coordinated the conduct of training and assessment for 165 Marines and certified two SIGINT Support Platoons for deployment. • Created job-specific guides for 203 Marines to direct their training, mentoring, education, and advancement while in the company. • Established a standardized two-week SIGINT introduction course for Marines newly-transferred to the company. • Organized all hardcopy and database training and evaluation correspondence in an easy-to-read catalogued library in the company office.

description: • Managed (31) enlisted Marines in preparation for deployment, receiving a certification of 83% collection rate where the average was 67%. • Led a working group of officers to create standardized billet descriptions for technical SIGINT-related jobs across a battalion of over (700) Marines. • Managed maintenance and accountability of a consolidated memorandum of receipt (CMR) account of (110) serialized end items with associated SL-3 components worth $9.1 million. • Performed Executive Officer duties for 23 days while the company was without an Executive Officer. • Created and maintained an electronic document library for more efficient access by all Marines in the company. • Advised combatant commanders on opponent capabilities and friendly force protection. • Served as senior Lay Leader while the battalion was without a Chaplain.

description: • Assists in collection, evaluation, and dissemination of naval intelligence in support of surface, air, and antisubmarine warfare units and operational staffs. Participates in reconnaissance missions and in interrogation of prisoners. Maintains order of battle information and intelligence plots. Prepares and develops intelligence reports. Develops intelligence estimates (per the American Council on Education). • Signals intelligence/ground electronic warfare (SIGINT/EW) officers command, or assist in commanding a SIGINT/EW unit and/or perform SIGINT/EW officer duties of a technical nature (per the American Council on Education).

description: National Security Agency Central Security Service (NSA/CSS) Hawaii – 2011-2014 - Surveillance and Warning Center Lead Technical and Product Reporter • Hold Top Secret/SCI clearance with a Single-Scope Background Investigation (SSBI) and a Counterintelligence polygraph since 2011. • Signals Intelligence Analyst with four years' experience. • Authored 2,800 SIGINT reports to tactical and strategic customers on high interest adversary operations. Kept war-fighters abreast of target nation's activities. • Provided Hawaii Regional SIGINT Operations Center's highest priority section with considerable hours of coverage and numerous position-unique reports on PACOM's highest priority target, contributing to a substantial number of reports distributed to the Nation's highest leadership. • Provided analysis in accordance with information needs used to provide details for long-term analysis of tactics, force disposition, as well as research and development advancements resulting in 300 product reports. • Identified threat warning situations, supporting the protection of Blue Forces. • Provided time-critical support to SRO missions over international waters. • Prepared and delivered mission briefings to senior level NSA military and civilian leadership. • Led numerous joint-service personnel through on-the-job training over multiple roles.

description: Tracked and reported on 150 Afghanistan National Key personnel; Utilized SIGINT to target and analyze IED trends for force protection. Maintained 100% situational awareness on key leader activities and locations; reported over 200 IEDs and assisted Brigade Commander in reducing IED facilitators in RC-N. Conducted pattern of life analysis to assist in the capture of 15 IED Facilitators. Transferred to Low Level Voice Intercept (LLVI) Team to conduct force protection and ground collection during the deployment; conducted over 20 LLVI operations throughout northern Afghanistan; responsible for the safety of two LLVI operators in a combat environment.

description: Lead reporter and analyst for Texas Maritime Analysis Support Team responsible for the analysis and reporting of narcotics vessels throughout the SOUTHCOM AOR. Implemented quality control measures that increased the accuracy of reports released, and maintained 100 percent accountability, assisted in the revision of the mission-reporting production line. Performed analysis of 109 vessels led to the seizure of 56 metric tons of illicit narcotics worth 653 million dollars. Established and maintained systematic, cross-referenced intelligence records and files.

description: • Authored multiple reports on high value CIED and CT global targets; led to duty-to-warn CIA and foreign partners and included in NSA executive summaries. • Discovered numerous CIED and CT selectors and many previously unknown targets. • Performed contact-chaining, metadata analysis, and queries on numerous selectors; resulted in an extensive array of viable intelligence and reportable items. • Coordinated with senior reporters on reporting instruction, topics, and branch reporting SOP. • Created and led structured basic DNI diagnostic and DNI mentorship program. • Collaborated with CIA, DIA, coalition partners, CENTCOM, and SOCOM to create the way ahead and methods for defeating terrorist IED networks.

description: • Performed extensive target development; led to the discovery of numerous unexploited targets and expanded the scope of collection by over 50%. • Created, tracked and updated target network packages; provided vital reports to internal customers. • Authored collection requirements and responses for tasking, level of effort and request for information. • Assigned tasking and prioritization of Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (ISR) platforms with relevant threat support in a strategic environment. • Conducted over 160 hours of DNI training; led to 100% trainee certification at a score of 90% or above. • Led two teams of multiple personnel during a high priority surge event covering numerous targets; led to a 50% increase in analysis, 100% increase in reporting, 25% increase in development, 100% situational coverage and contributed to operational accomplishment award. • Hand-selected from numerous personnel to be the first Navy Sailor to attend Airman Leadership School at Lackland, AFB.

description: Oversees, coordinates and executes 25th Air Force participation in joint and national exercises in accordance with AFI 10-204, Participation in Joint and National Exercises, and annual Exercise Campaign Plan. Provides support for military joint exercises involving ISR-specific objectives, develops action plans to achieve those specified ISR training objectives and enhance ISR scenario simulations. Sets priorities and determine the level of exercise participation for 25th Air Force. Evaluates expected requirements with consideration to the potential training value for exercises involving ISR integration. Coordinates, approves, and funds 25th Air Force unit participation in exercise planning efforts. Validates 25th Air Force requirements in the Deployment Requirements Manning Document (DRMD) through the Defense Crisis Action Planning and Execution Segments (DCAPES). Maintains exercise schedule and track 25th Air Force worldwide participation in exercises

description: Coordinated on all Air Expeditionary Forces requirements for the Air Force Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance Agency (AFISRA) in accordance with AFI 10-244, Reporting Status of Air Expeditionary Forces; monitored Unit Type Codes (UTC) and Unit Manpower Document (UMD) authorization mismatches and notified Functional Area Managers (FAM) when mismatches existed. Executed the deployment portion of DCAPES/Time Phased Force Deployment Data (TPFDD) and Deployment Requirement Manning Documents (DRMD) taskings. Managed deployment readiness and training aspects for all deployable personnel and equipment; performed UTC development, management, and maintenance activities according to AFI 10-401, Air Force Operations Planning and Execution. Ensured SORTS Designated Operational Capabilities (DOC) Statements accurately reflected unit wartime mission(s) requirements and capabilities in accordance with AFI 10-201, Status of Resources and Training Systems (SORTS). Provided guidance to Wing FAMs for construction and maintenance of unit capability (i.e. UTCs) and associated SORTS DOC Statement. Assisted AFISRA FAMs with preparation of SORTS DOC Statements. Managed and scheduled all intelligence officer and Enlisted Career field (14N and 1NX) deployment requirements at the execution phase for the Air Force ISR Agency; coordinated with AF Personnel Center/DPW schedulers to resolve requirement conflicts and mitigate shortfalls.

Executed quality review for enlisted evaluations, decorations, family care, and quarterly/annual award programs; secured counseling, religious, medical, and financial support services for assigned members. Coordinated with base leadership and support agencies to secure crucial services for individual, families, facilities, and operational missions performed at geographically separated unit. Coordinated manning requirements with the National Security Agency Europe (NSA) and the Air Force Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance Agency (AF ISR Agency) to conduct ISR operations in support of the Intelligence Community (IC).

description: Served as Senior enlisted advisor for several enlisted, officer, government civilian, and contractor personnel working in four branches within Counter- Terrorism Division at Texas Cryptologic Center. Insured each functional branch complied with mission requirements and abide by strict legal mandates of the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act. Ensured that all branches met the needs of more than 15 agencies and customers. Developed/managed division’s annual budget and safeguards highly-valued specialized equipment in support of counter-terrorism operations; prioritized division’s human resources requirements. Advised squadron and flight commanders on the employment and training of more than 50 Airmen assigned to the Counter-Terrorism and Counter- Proliferation Divisions. description: support to two Numbered Air Forces (NAF) and associated Air Operation Centers (AOC) supporting SOUTHCOM and European Command. Advised leadership on job requirements, posting, and selection of future candidates; monitored operational activities and performance of awarded government contracts. Executed section’s budget and manages highly specialized equipment to provide real-time, theater focused signals intelligence (SIGINT) for Target Development, Intelligence Preparation of the Battlespace, and Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (ISR) planning and execution activities against insurgents and narcotics traffickers in SOUTHCOM theater. Deployed to Colombia as US Military group Liaison to Planning, Assistance & Training Team for six months. Conducted tactics, leadership, and intelligence training for more than 400 allied soldiers; oversaw development of Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures for exploitation and prosecution of High Value Targets by national, strategic, and tactical customers. Established criteria for terrorist-related reporting for force protection operations and served as translator/liaison for host nation forces. Sanitized and relayed thousands intelligence reports; assisted in geo-locating high value targets; helped save hundreds of host nation lives.

description: Primary advisor to the commander regarding assignment, rotation, and future utilization of all Air Force personnel assigned to the National Security Agency/Central Security Service, Texas. Conducted billet reviews and administered Air Force manning support to the Signal Intelligence Directorate. Acted as commander's liaison for temporary duty assignments, training, mission adjustments and requirements, and all administrative issues regarding Air Force personnel. Developed and implemented strategy to enhance mission effectiveness and maximize mission accomplishment and Airmen Professional development. Directed 19-Senior Non-Commissioned Officer flight to ensure effective unit communication, implementation of squadron strategic plan, and clear guidance to operational managers. Identified and secured formal language, analytical, and advanced comm systems training for Air Force personnel. Oversaw skill sets identification, training and deployment preparation for Air Combat Command's largest squadron and coordinated deployment rotations in support of US Central Command. Negotiated employment of secret-level indoctrinated Airmen in support of War on Drugs/Global War On Terror efforts, driving collection/reporting to positively impact anti-terrorism/counter-narcotic operations.

description: •Top Secret Sensitive Compartmented Information Clearance with Counter Intelligence POLYGRAPH. •Responsible for monitoring unevaluated traffic as it is received by the Afghan Remote Operations Crypto-logical Centre (AROCC) ONEROOF server resident on National Security Agency NSANet, and manipulates it as required to ensure proper processing. •Conducts SIGINT operations coordination and synchronization, and other SIGINT activities as necessary. •Provided direct support to the Brigade Combat Teams (BCTs) as appropriate. •Supports the timely, relevant, accurate and predictive SIGINT and Electronic Warfare support to enable the commander and subordinate unit commanders the ability to understand their battlespace and enemy forces. •Possessed working knowledge of relevant NSA tasking, collection, processing, reporting procedures, and communications architecture. •Possessed working knowledge of military ground and operations, target-area geography, place names, personal names, titles, and cultural norms, as well as relevant enemy objectives, tactics, techniques and procedures. •Provided indications and warnings tipping and force protection reports.

description: • Has the ability to detect, collect, classify, and analyze transmissions by foreign countries. • Processed countless indication and warning alerts, meeting the needs of our Intelligence partners worldwide. • Conducted COMINT analysis in support of several major theatre missions constantly contributing to national situational awareness. • Provided time sensitive intelligence, ensuring that all on and off theatre assets received timely, accurate intelligence reports. • Trained several new members on our Job Qualifications standards guide, reducing management to employee operational issues. • Performed Signals Identification by analyzing the collected parameters of a specific signal, and either matching its known criteria, or recording it as a possible new emitter.

description: • Provided Unbiased, responsive and innovated Collection Management services to support a diverse, worldwide customer base. • Coordinated with internal and external work centers to identify and locate high-value entities associated with opposing forces weapons systems. • Prioritized SIGINT tasking to maximize the effective use of collection resources. • Optimized resources on a day to day basis to satisfy a wide range of intelligence request. • Worked with various departments of defense tools to ensure mission timelines and Intelligence request were always met. • Possessed a proficient knowledge of understanding collection equities, sources, and methods. • Ensured War fighters and National-Level decision makers received valuable force protection intelligence on a near real-time basis.

description: Responsible for the identification and capture of C5ISR related opportunities for Raytheon IIS to include: • Shaping an integrated strategy and environmental assessment of the assigned customers within the Navy and the intelligence community with a focus on future opportunities. • Leading the development of Naval strategic and tactical strategies for business growth and specific pursuits • Building relationships between Raytheon the Navy and Intelligence Community customers • Providing customer intelligence, awareness and knowledge of critical customer activities and communicating information as appropriate within the enterprise. • Identifying new business opportunities; support businesses in pursuing lateral opportunities and support current programs that are critical to the company • Engaging the customers on requirements development, procurement and mission support activities. • Representing ideas, solutions and capabilities by conducting timely capabilities sessions with senior-level Navy and IC customers. • Maintaining close working relationships with Business Development personnel and other business leaders across product lines. • Supporting the Business Development process and bidding & proposal activities.

description: • Led Multi-source Intelligence System Development: Identified next-generation multi-source intelligence capabilities that satisfied national and fleet requirements for intelligence collection, processing and dissemination. Prioritized spiral upgrades to current systems and coordinated acquisition of new systems with multiple resource sponsors and the intelligence community. • Acted as the Technical Demonstration Coordinator: Planed and executed technical demonstrations, evaluated and tested cryptologic systems, equipment and concepts in support of fleet and national objectives. • Led Future Systems Capability Development: Drafted requirements, concepts, and identified potential funding sources. Identified requirements for and coordinated life cycle support, engineering technical support, operators, training, and test and range equipment required to effectively field and test emerging cryptologic capabilities. • Led Navy Cryptologic Requirements Development: Served as the principle liaison to the National Security Agency/Central Security Service (NSA/CSS) for Navy integration of national cryptologic systems and capabilities. Represented FLTCYBERCOM and OPNAV Military Intelligence Program (MIP) cryptologic systems requirements to NSA.

description: Since moving from the AFCERT, I have been involved in providing mission assurance analysis support across the 24 AF, most notably in the 688th Cyberspace Wing, in support of identifying anomalous adversary activity on the AF enterprise. Since October of 2009, I have been serving the 24 AF, 688 CW, 90 IOS and 92 IOS in the development, enhancement, assessment, and integration of network security technologies, incident response, intelligence integration, and CPT defense against adversarial network intrusion activity. For more than five years, I have evaluated applications and capabilities for Intrusion Detection/ Intrusion Prevention System (IDS/IPS) integration. I provide subject matter expertise in the design and update of IDS/IPS components for use by the Cyber Warfighter and have validated TTPs by participating in exercises such as Red Flag, Cyber Flag, Black Demon, Terminal Fury, etc.. I currently lead a Mission Assurance Team of Developers, Testers, Integrators, and Analysts that bridge the gap between innovation and operation in order to contest adversarial advancement and technique. Furthermore, I serve as a senior traffic analyst and trainer for CPT operators in the 92 IOS.
